maintenanceevent.eventdescription: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday June 18, 2024 at 12:18

did.abstract: Cope, Colorado, was named after Johnathan C. Cope, an officer of the Burlington Railroad Company. The Cope Congregational Church, according to Richard Taylor, was founded in 1896 and closed in 1910 and Taylor states that Happy Valley Congregational Church was founded in 1917 and closed in 1919. This collection contains a series of photographs that depict various buildings from in and around Cope, Colorado.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted and open to the public.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Colorado Springs, Colo. Second Congregational Church records, 1889-1966, RG5509. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were donated to the Congregational Library & Archives by the Rocky Mountain Conference, August 2021; accession 2021-07.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Zachary Bodnar, June 2024, using Describing Archives: A Content Standard.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Cope, Colorado, was named after Johnathan C. Cope, an officer of the Burlington Railroad Company who was sent by the company to the area to homestead a railroad terminal site. Cope Colorado has had an operational post office since 1889. The Cope Congregational Church, according to Richard Taylor, was founded in 1896 and closed in 1910. Also, according to Taylor, there was a Happy Valley Congregational Church in Cope from 1917 to 1919. These churches may have been succeeded by the Cope Community Church which is active today.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains a series of photographs that depict various buildings from in and around Cope, Colorado. There is also a photograph that depicts the exterior of the First Congregational Church in Stratton, Congregational. Every photograph has a caption. There is a note with the photographs that suggests that the photographs came from a Church in Cope, however, the Congregational Churches in Cope had closed before the dates on the photographs. As such, the exact provenance of the collection is questionable.
